bill_title: to revise the authority of a local school board to regulate participation by seventh and eighth grade students in extra-curricular activities.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the authority of a local school board to regulate participation by seventh and eighth grade students in extra-curricular activities. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No local school board may restrict participation in any extra-curricular activities by seventh or eighth grade students if the South Dakota High School Activities Association does not forbid those students to participate. Any local school board may promulgate rules, policies, and scholastic standards for participation in extra-curricular activities if the minimum standards of the South Dakota High School Activities Association are met. Any rule, policy, or scholastic standard promulgated by a local school board for participation in extra-curricular activity shall apply uniformly to all students in grades seven through twelve. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
